greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Alternating sums of the ordered Bell numbers (number of preferential arrangements) A000670.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n) = sum((-1)^(n-k)*t(k), k=0..n), where t = A000670 (ordered Bell numbers).
G.f.: 1/(1+x)/Q(0), where Q(k)= 1 - x*(k+1)/(1 - x*(2*k+2)/Q(k+1)); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 20 2013
maple: seq(sum((-1)^(n-k)*sum(factorial(j)*stirling2(k,j), j=0..k), k=0..n), n=0..30); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Feb 07 2018
mathematica: t[n_] := Sum[StirlingS2[n, k]k!, {k, 0, n}]; Table[Sum[(-1)^(n - k)t[k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 100}]

Fubini[n_, r_] := Sum[k!*Sum[(-1)^(i+k+r)(i+r)^(n-r)/(i!*(k-i-r)!), {i, 0, k-r}], {k, r, n}]; Fubini[0, 1] = 1; a[n_] := Sum[(-1)^(n-k) Fubini[k, 1], {k, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 31 2016 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0,30, print1(sum(k=0,n, (-1)^(n-k)*sum(j=0,k, j!*stirling(k,j,2))), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 07 2018
results.author: _Emanuele Munarini_, Oct 02 2012
